result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Read in for purposes of sentencing in 14CF132

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangelo M. Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:38 p.m. Defendant Deangelo M. Jones in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Deangelo M. Jones in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf132, 15cf91, 14fo813, 14fo814. Court statement to jury trial. All parties in receipt/review of PSI. Chernin statement trespass/vandalism/escape on page 4 of PSI - Chernin states that no cases existed on CCAP - Defendant stated charges are not his. Court finds there are no proof that such history exists for this defendant and matter should not be considered for purposes of sentencing. Neither party intends to call witnesses today. State moves to dismiss but read-in 15cf91 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 14fo814 and 14fo813 - Granted. Schiek/Chernin/Defendant statement to Court on sentencing read by Attorney Chernin/Court statement on sentencing. Chernin files Defendant's statement. 
Court Sentence
Prison - 6 years --Initial Confinement - 3 years; Extended Supervision - 3 years
Jail Credit - 243 days
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program
CC/Supervision Fees
AODA or mental health treatment deemed appropriate by PO
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adj. 3:29 p.m.
Per Judge Bloom - start date of JT moved to 10/7/15
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Deangelo M. Jones in court attorney Michael L. Chernin appears telephonically.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 15CF91 - Information Sheet filed and court notes 14FO813 and 14F0814 tracking with case.  Information Sheet filed for 15CF91.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Bail continued.  Court goes over information sheet for 15CF91.  Atty Chernin waives any further reading and enters a Not Guilty plea on defendant's behalf.  Court enters Not Guilty plea and sets over for PTC.  Atty Chernin regarding bail.  Atty Chernin asking for modifcation of bond from $10,000 that was set in 15CF91 to $3700 - cash plus additional $3750 signature bond and states reasons.  Atty Schiek statement regarding modification of bond -objects to modifcation and states reasons.  Motion is granted to modify bond and Court reduces to $5000 cash bond and all conditions of bond remain the same.  Motion is granted to modify.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

03:38 pm - Defendant Deangelo M. Jones in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15CF91 (PH), 14CF132, 14FO813-814.  Court questions defendant as to retaining new counsel.  Jones states has retained Michael Chernin from Milwaukee - thought attorney would be calling court today, spoke with Atty Chernin this past Tuesday.  Defendant requests rescheduling of preliminary hearing.   As defendant requests rescheduling of the preliminary hearing; court finds a waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  Court directs defendant to contact Attorney Chernin regarding the next hearing date.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Notified Judy, ONSO Dispatch, to cancel warrant as defendant was taken into custody prior to hearing.

08:46 am - Defendant Deangelo M. Jones in court, in custody, in court with attorney James Edgar Toran for today's purposes of setting bond.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant taken into custody prior to hearing.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing.  Schiek/Toran to bond.  Court sets cash bond.  Court advises defendant of right to counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
